;;2023-12-03 15:00:00;
;

;;

;

;At the beginning of this century, Wang Xiancai and his wife Zeng Hanying revisited their birthplace.

;

;My ancestral home is Yongan Township, Jiujiang County, Jiangxi Province. In the 1920s, my grandfather moved the family to Shanghai. In the 22nd year of the Republic of China (1933); the sixteenth day of the ninth lunar month, I was born in "Jianye Lane", Fululi Road, ;(now Jianguo West Road); in the French Concession in Shanghai. October 30, 2023 is my 90th birthday.

;

;When my wife Zeng Hanying and I revisited our former residence at the beginning of this century, Jianyeli had become a dilapidated building and was about to be demolished and rebuilt, and the residents had all moved out. The guard asked about the purpose of his visit and allowed me, an old resident, to go in and walk around, leaving this photo at the door of the alley.

;

;In the autumn of 1946, I returned to Jiujiang with my parents and lived in the ancestral house bought by my grandfather on Dutian Lane. It was an old house with two front and back floors. When Jiujiang was liberated in May 1949, I was a freshman in Tongwen Middle School. In the spring of 1951, when he was about to enter his junior year of high school, he was ordered to study at the Central South Youth League School in Wuhan ; (Jiangxi Province was then part of the Central South District);. When I returned from graduation in July, the Communist Youth League Committee asked me to stay in the student department and formally join the workforce. The pace of life slows down. I was not used to the life of a government cadre. At this time, the first unified entrance examination for colleges and universities across the country had passed. Suddenly I found that Shandong University School of Medicine had to recruit students separately, so I asked to resign and study further. The student minister agreed, but the organization minister believed that this was caused by bourgeois individualism, and he refused to obey the organization's decision and ordered him to "resign" from the group. This was the first political blow I suffered and became my “original sin.” People of insight believe that the ups and downs I experienced in the first half of my life were all related to this.

;

;After being forced to "resign" from the group, he bid farewell to his parents, sadly left home, and went to Qingdao to successfully enter the School of Medicine at Shanda University.

;

;;

;

;Registration photo for Shandong University.

;

;;Although I have never thought about studying medicine, I have to do this, otherwise I will have to wait another year. Later I discovered that this passively accepted major also protected me to a great extent. ;

;

;Because I paid a heavy price to get the opportunity to enter a higher education, I learned from the experience and worked harder than ever before. At that time, there were no textbooks in the university, so I mainly relied on taking notes during class. I listened attentively, requiring myself not only to understand, but also to remember in class. After class, I compiled notes from memory, and then supplemented them with Chinese and foreign materials I read in the library, so I learned more than what I heard in class. of more. I was the first in the class in every test score in all courses during college. Mr. Lu Yunming, professor of Physiology, made an exception and gave me 110 points on the 100% test paper because my answer exceeded what he taught in class. Thirty years later, I returned to Qingdao to attend the school anniversary event, and Mr. Lu happily mentioned this to me. Importantly, I also started my medical translation career at Shandong University.

;

;;

;

;While studying at Shandong University, I took photos on the Qingdao beachfront.

;

;After entering the clinical course, I learned that there is a world-renowned medical masterpiece "His Internal Medicine" in the United States. The teachers jokingly called it the "Das Kapital" of clinical medicine. I went to the school library to register and queue up, and borrowed this heavy masterpiece. While reading and studying, I was deeply impressed by its profoundness, systematic and rigorous discussion, and its emphasis on the connection between clinical and basic theory, so I came up with the idea of ​​translating it into Chinese. I think this is a very meaningful thing.

;

;A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step. I want to do it in two steps: first translate a smaller book, and then move on to that big book after gaining experience. Later, I chose "An Approach to Clinical Surgery;" (;An Approach to Clinical Surgery;) written by Professor HC Owens of the United Kingdom for interns and junior residents. I felt that the content of this book was It's something I can control.

;

;However, whether I wanted to translate "His Internal Medicine" or tried to translate this booklet, it was still a secret of mine at that time. There was only one close friend in the same class;(Liu Piren);Knowing this, he has always been optimistic about me and encouraged me, and even found a "secret" translation place for me, which is the small building on the roof of the third surgical ward. attic. It was a low, cramped small room covered with cobwebs and dust. I had to bend down to get in. The "tables" are stacked soap boxes, sitting on bricks wrapped in newspaper. I get up early every morning and hide here to translate books. There was no electricity in the attic, so candles were the only way to light it. My eyesight is not good. When I look closely, I often smell a burning smell, which means my hair is burning. I work until six or seven o'clock and quietly return to the dormitory, keeping up with the rhythm of life of my classmates, washing, eating, and going to the ward together.

;

;;

;

;Photos from the time when I was secretly translating books in the attic.

;

;I kept a low profile and did a good job of keeping it secret. Until I finished translating this little book of more than 200,000 words, no one discovered my "underground activities." In 1993, I returned to Qingdao to attend the anniversary event of my alma mater. Liu Jingru, my classmate who lived in the bunk below me at that time, ;(then the director of Qingdao Municipal Health Bureau);Admitted that he had no idea about these activities of mine at that time.

;

;;

;

;In 1993, he returned to Qingdao Medical University to participate in the school anniversary event and took a photo with his old classmate Liu Jingru (middle) who was the director of Qingdao Health Bureau at the time.

;

;When "Instructions for Clinical Surgery" was published by Shanghai Health Publishing House in 1957, I had already graduated and was working in Beijing.

;

;;

;

;After this little book was published, I went through many ups and downs and almost lost everything. This is a used book I bought online. I accidentally found it on a used book website. At least it is still good. There have been three reprints: Shanghai Science and Technology Press (1960, 1961) and Hong Kong Commercial Press (1970).

;

;Enter "His"

;

;The publication of "Instructions for Clinical Surgery" gave me great encouragement. I bought back the 9th edition of "His Internal Medicine" and began to It marches on. This translation is not an "underground activity". My colleagues all know that I am doing it. But I was unlucky, and soon the anti-rightist movement came. Although I got through 1957, the year when I became famous, without incident, because the hospital’s anti-rightist goals were not fulfilled, in June 1958, I was still classified as a rightist for “unreasonable opinions” on Soviet medicine. By this time, the anti-rightist climax had passed, and I and two other right-wing recruits were not sent out. We stayed in the hospital to supervise labor and were given a monthly living allowance of 32 yuan.

;

;Two months later, the hospital was suddenly ordered to move to Hohhot, Inner Mongolia to support the local Great Leap Forward. The pressure I feel is also increasing. Finally, on a bright and clear night, the translated manuscript of the 9th edition of "His", about 400,000 words, was burned in a wasteland next to the hospital. Although I felt very miserable, I could still convince myself that now was not the time to translate the book, and I had to work hard to take off this "hat" on my head. Science is always evolving, and a new version will come out when the time comes, and I will start over.    

;

;Since 1960, I have been ordered to act as "acting attending physician". Every morning, I lead the residents and interns in ward rounds. At this time, I am their superior. After the ward rounds, they return to the office and I sweep the floor, clean the tables, and empty the toilets for the patients. Whatever patients need me to do and I can do, I do it proactively. Because I am different from them, I am a right-winger under supervision. At that time, they were the enemies of the people, the "reactionaries". So what I think about day and night and think about in my heart is "taking off my hat".

;

;Looking forward to the stars, looking forward to the moon, and finally looking forward to this day. In November 1961, the Party Committee of the Academy announced that I would be "retired". At this time, the situation also changed a lot: the Soviet Union became the "Soviet revisionist" and the target of our criticism, and was no longer the "big brother". I returned to my old business, bought the 11th edition of "His", and started to study "His" again.

;

;But as luck would have it, the "Four Cleanups" movement came again. The leader of the working group leading the movement warned me: Don’t relapse, as the “rightist” label can be put back on again after you take it off! These words hit home for me. I have to pull back from the brink! Finally, the re-translated 11th edition of the manuscript of "His" ; (also more than 400,000 words); was placed next to the hospital. The wasteland was set on fire.

;

;A famous person once said that the most painful thing in life is waking up from a dream with no way out. When I am wearing the "hat", I can dream about doing it again after taking off the "hat". What path can I take now, what can I dream about?

;

;Life is sometimes cruel but also interesting: more than twenty years later, I was invited to return to Hohhot. When I was discussing with scientific and technical personnel in the Inner Mongolia Science and Technology Building, I discovered that this building is the same hospital where I used to work. Next, it was built on the wasteland where I burned manuscripts twice. I couldn’t help but tell them about this past event.

;

;Upgrade again

;

;The "Four Clean-ups" movement has not yet completely ended, but it has entered a decade of catastrophe. I was punished as a "rightist without hats" and upgraded to an "active counterrevolutionary". I was sentenced to 12 years in prison, deprived of political rights for 4 years, and entered a labor camp. Fortunately, the authorities took advantage of my skills and allowed me to serve my sentence in the health department of the labor camp, avoiding regular labor.

;

;In 1971, Cheng Dalu, a fellow prisoner who was released after serving his sentence, gave me a tightly wrapped "gift". When I opened it, I saw that it was the 13th edition of "His Internal Medicine"! Cheng Dalu was an educated youth from Shanghai who was transferred to Shanxi. He was sentenced to five years in prison for "counterrevolutionary" crimes. He was hospitalized here for a long time because of pleurisy. We get along well. He knew that I was determined to translate "His Internal Medicine" and kept it in mind. At that time, it was stipulated that people who lived in big cities and along the coast could not go home after release and had to stay in the factory >;Employment. So he could take advantage of the fact that every day after the prisoners went to work and there were no guards in the cell, he could send me books. Cheng Dalu only has a "salary" of 29 yuan per month, and he also has to support his younger sister who is sent to Anhui. But after he discovered the newly released "His Internal Medicine" (photocopy) in a foreign language bookstore, he tried every means and sold his clothes to buy it for me.

;

;;

;

;In 1984, we met again after the robbery on Hechengda Road in Jiujiang (left in the picture).

;

;Suddenly I saw the long-lost "He", things have changed and people have changed, and the feeling in my heart is really indescribable.

;

;After the prisoners go to work every day, they eat lunch at the construction site and do not return from work until 6 p.m. So I can read a book after I finish handling the affairs in the ward in the morning, and I can calm down by eight or nine o'clock after I finish handling the patients sent by each team for consultation in the evening. I looked through the 13th edition of "His" and found that with the advancement of the times, the content is very different from previous editions. His Majesty himself has long since retired. There are 177 authors of this book. The chief editor is Professor Paul B. Beeson of Oxford University (later transferred to the University of Washington in the United States).

;

;;

;

;A signed photo given to me by Bison, chief editor of the 13th, 14th and 15th editions of "His Internal Medicine".

;

;Translating books in prison

;

;I can’t help but want to use this opportunity to translate books. I didn't do it impulsively or whimsically, but after careful consideration and serious consideration. Since I arrived at the labor camp, I have been conscientious and cautious in my work. I have never made any mistakes or had any medical accidents. Analytical balances, photoelectric colorimeter, and laboratory were established to perform clinical and biochemical tests carried out in general hospitals at the time One year's reward);, so the leader trusts me very much. I think I can win the support of the leadership.

;

;According to regulations, cadres are not allowed to come to see me for medical treatment. However, starting from the factory leader and political commissar Li Hengwen, they often come to see me for medical treatment. Of course, I have no right to refuse.

;

;Political Commissar Li came to see me again that day. He was about fifty years old at the time, a veteran anti-Japanese cadre and former public security chief. He often suffers from a slow heart rate and the cause is unknown. After careful examination and examination, I thought it was a manifestation of coronary heart disease. At that time when supplies were in short supply and people were generally malnourished, coronary heart disease was still very rare in China. Large hospitals occasionally saw a few cases of coronary heart disease and myocardial infarction, and the papers they wrote could be published in national academic journals. Doctors have little experience with this and have difficulty accessing foreign medical information. Later, hospitals outside the hospital also recognized my diagnosis, which also increased Political Commissar Li's trust in me and asked me how I came to have coronary heart disease from a slow heart rate. I took the opportunity to bring out the big book and said that it was what it told me and I wanted to translate it so that more Chinese doctors could read it.

;

;Commissar Li flipped through the big book but did not answer me. No words were spoken for a long time. I felt a little uneasy and should not have presumed to make this request.

;

;He closed the book and said to me: "Since it is such a good book, you can translate it here. We support you. If the translation cannot be published, we will print it for you!" ”

;

;That’s what he said, and I still remember it vividly.

;

;Learning "Dumb Japanese"

;

;In this way, I translated "His Internal Medicine" for the third time in the labor camp, hoping to realize my wish as a student. Translating books in such a closed environment naturally presents many difficulties. Although there were many capable people among the reform-through-labor prisoners during that period, it was still difficult to find anyone to discuss the more professional issues. I remember that when I translated a piece of content about CT, I got stuck. Nowadays, CT is a household name, but at that time, CT had just come out. I couldn't guess from the two English words "computerized tomography" what this "artifact" for examination, referred to as CT, was , SimKai, STKaiti;">;(literally "computer-processed tomography");.

;

;Take a message from prisoners in this city and ask their families to help find explanatory materials about CT. I finally found a copy and sent it in, but it was in Japanese.

;

;There happens to be a Japanese expert in the ward: Mr. Luo Yuanzhen, professor of the Department of History of Shanxi University. Mr. Luo studied at Waseda University in Japan in his early years and married a Japanese lady ; (suspected to be a "Japanese spy");. He is a "future" "Convicted criminals" were also sent as the detention center was overcrowded.

;

;But Mr. Luo, who is separated by lines and is proficient in Japanese, cannot read the Japanese information about CT, saying that you can only read it yourself; if you don’t understand Japanese, you can learn it. I'm still a little hesitant: Is it too much to learn a foreign language just to read some Japanese information? Mr. Luo said that it can be done quickly: learn "dumb Japanese" and just read books, not speak or write articles, it only takes a few months. In that environment, there was no choice but this. So the translation was suspended and I started learning Japanese with Mr. Luo.

;

;;

;

;My Japanese teacher in prison, Mr. Luo Yuanzhen (1906-1993), a professor at Shanxi University.

;

;After daily rounds, I invite Mr. Luo to my room ; (should be said "prison unit");Come and learn Japanese. In less than a month, the "dumb Japanese" mastered Japanese and understood the Japanese information about CT, and then returned to the translation of "His".

;

;On a night in late September 1975, the entire 13th edition of "Historical Records" ; (3.4 million words)< /span>;The Chinese translation is finally completed. I put the final translation I wrote into the translated manuscript. There are 300 words per page, and the pages are numbered to more than 11,000 pages. The numbering is like a small mountain, trembling.

;

;My wish as a student has finally come true, but time has passed and I am no longer young. I am still translating books under such circumstances, which is sad! Although I can feel a little relieved that my long-cherished wish has finally come true, almost at the same time, another indescribable sadness has penetrated my body and mind: Will I be forced to burn them again...;

;It was late at night and the prison cell was silent. My place is very close to the big wall. I can see the high-voltage wires rustling in the wind on the high wall and the sentries on the watchtowers with guns and live ammunition...

;

;Change of sentence and release

;

;Complete translation of " Less than ten days after the 13th edition of "His Internal Medicine", my life faced another major change: the Inner Mongolia High Court decided to revoke my original sentence and change my sentence to eight years! This is the result of Comrade Xiaoping's second comeback and his proposal to rectify all walks of life based on Mao Zedong's "Three Instructions." I was arrested and sentenced in 1967. Based on this calculation, I have already served 8 years in prison, so I decided to commute my sentence to 8 years. But they don't understand that my sentence has been reduced by one year. It would be more "appropriate" and "accurate" if my sentence was reduced to nine years. The day the sentence modification was issued was September 27, 1975. Just sit as much as you like. There was no talk of state compensation at that time, and I had nothing to say. The labor camp decided to release him and allowed me to take away all the translations of the 13th edition of "His Internal Medicine".

;

;;

;

;The 3.4 million-word manuscript of the 13th edition of "His Internal Medicine" was translated in prison and is now in the Jiujiang Museum.

;

;I returned to my hometown of Jiujiang and lived with my mother. Soon I was hired as a temporary worker in a factory hospital ;(doctor);, earning 34.5 yuan per month. At this time, the 14th edition of "He" became available. I bought it back and used it to compare, update, and supplement the translation of the 13th edition.

;

;In December 1978, the Party Central Committee held the historic Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee, which changed from "class struggle as the key link" to economic construction as the center. The central government issued Document No. 55, which "removed" right-wing elements across the country. Any wrong demarcations would be corrected and they would lose their job arrangements. I was placed in Jiujiang Second People's Hospital. However, corrections and vindication must be done by the original unit. So in 1980, I returned to my original workplace in Inner Mongolia.

;

;Signed for publication

;

;The corrections by the rightists and the redress of injustices went smoothly, and there was an unexpected surprise: because my injustices were all during the catastrophe, according to regulations, all the wages that were deducted and fined at that time were It can be reissued, so I suddenly became a “10,000-yuan household”! This was a huge amount of money at the time. While I was waiting for the step-by-step approval, I went to the Inner Mongolia People's Publishing House to inquire about publishing matters for a friend's book manuscript. The editor who received me, Xu Cheng, is the deputy director in charge of the science and technology editorial office. Xu Cheng was not interested in his friend's manuscript and asked casually: Are there any other manuscripts? I also replied casually: "Are you interested in the big manuscript? "His Internal Medicine"." Unexpectedly, Xu Cheng's eyes lit up and he became more energetic. He asked me carefully about the manuscript and my situation, and asked me to give him some time. More than 20 days later, Xu Cheng came to me to sign a contract and said that they decided to publish it in 10 volumes one after another, all in three years!

;

;Xu Cheng’s words shocked me: Is this such a big decision for such a big book? We have never met each other, how can he trust me?

;

;It turns out that he has done a lot of work around this book these days: he knew that I was a doctor and found out that I was famous in Inner Mongolia back then; he retrieved the book I translated in the early years from the library. I have carefully read the "Instructions for Clinical Surgery"; I also held two symposiums, one of which was specially held in Beijing to solicit the opinions of participating experts on the publication of "His Internal Medicine" and received unanimous affirmation and support. , then reported to the leader and asked me to sign a contract.

;

;I think the more important reason should be: Reform and opening up, many wastes are waiting to be done, and people are eager to understand the outside world. However, after these years of hard work, English talents are rare and there are not many left. I finally It came to life, and there was this ready-made translation. This is my luck, in fact, it is also my fluke. Despite this, I still admire Xu Cheng's professionalism very much. He is 12 years younger than me and graduated from the Biology Department of Inner Mongolia University in 1966. From then on, he and I became lifelong friends.

;

;;

;

;Xu Cheng (right in the picture) and I discussed the publication of "His Internal Medicine".

;

;When I returned to Jiujiang, I immediately sent the first translation of "Volume 5" on cardiovascular disease to Xu Cheng. At that time, printing was still the age of lead type. I chose to publish this volume first, not because I am a doctor in this profession, but because of Xu Cheng’s marketing considerations: there are many people suffering from cardiovascular disease, so it is easy to sell ;">;(It turned out to be true. The initial printing of 10,000 copies sold out two months later, and more copies were printed immediately);. But during the typesetting period, I received the 15th edition of "His", and the content also changed a lot! The number of authors has increased to 277, the length of the book has also expanded to about 5 million words, and even the layout style is very different.

;

;This is another severe test for me.

;

;I can take a relatively easy path: according to the contract requirements, I will send out the completed translation manuscripts one after another and finish the book in three years. This is not considered backward internationally. But after all, I did not publish books for the sake of publishing books, but pursued it as a career. If I cannot dedicate the latest and best version to readers, even if this book comes out, I will leave deep regrets. After a fierce inner struggle at night, I got up at dawn and wrote a letter to Xu Cheng. As soon as the letter was sent, I couldn't help but go to the telecommunications office to make a long-distance call to him, explain the whole story, and ask him to immediately notify the printing factory to stop printing and recover the translation. I decided to start from scratch and re-translate the entire 15th edition of the book, and promised to hand over the first 500,000-word translation of Volume 5 within three months. The 10 volumes of the book will be released in about three years!

;

;Retranslation of the 15th edition

;

;This is my fifth translation of "Hebrew", and I strive to fully realize my early wish. I know the difficulty and workload of re-translating the entire book, but I think no matter how difficult it is, it will be much more convenient than translating the book in the labor camp. In order to save time, I never took any holidays from now on, and I also gave up the habit of taking a lunch break that I had developed over the years. I get up early every morning, stay up late and work at my desk. In February 1982, the first volume 5 was published as scheduled. At the end of December 1984, the translation of the 15th edition of "His Internal Medicine" was finally completed, totaling 4.7 million words.

;

;;

;

;Days and nights of re-translating the 15th edition of "His Internal Medicine".

;

;In June 1985, all ten volumes were published. Although we have gone through some twists and turns, we are still the first country in the world to launch the 15th edition of "His Internal Medicine".

;

;;

;

;The complete Chinese translation of the 15th edition of "His Internal Medicine" published in 10 volumes in 1985.

;

;Looking back over the years, I have been exposed to five different versions, burned the manuscript twice, and translated the book five times, translating a total of about 10.7 million words.

;

;The Ministry of Health organized a review of the Chinese translation of "His Internal Medicine" and the experts expressed satisfaction with the quality of the translation. The Ministry of Health decided to establish a "Special Award for Medical Translation". In February 1987, Minister Cui Yueli awarded me the award at the Ministry of Health. My wife Zeng Hanying was also invited to attend the award ceremony because of her hard work in the translation and publishing process. This award is the only one so far. A year later, Xu Cheng also won the Bole Award, an important publishing award in Inner Mongolia.

;

;;

;

;Received the "Special Award for Medical Translation" at the Ministry of Health in the spring of 1987, front row from left: Vice Minister of Health Gu Yingqi, Minister Cui Yueli, Wang Xiancai and his wife, Ministry of Health Science and Technology Director of the Department.

;

;I am not the first person in China to translate "His Internal Medicine". During the Republic of China, the Chinese Medical Association organized a group of domestic experts to collectively translate and publish the seventh edition of "His", but it was limited to internal medicine-related content, not the entire book, so the title "His Internal Medicine" was used. The original book has extensive content, including various systems of clinical internal medicine, including surgery, obstetrics and gynecology, pediatrics, dermatology and venereal diseases, eyes, ears, nose and throat, as well as public health, medical statistics, clinical testing and radiological diagnosis, medical genetics and ethics, etc. Therefore, the original title of the book is ";Cecil Textbook of Medicine;" "font-family: Kaiti, Kaiti_GB2312, SimKai, STKaiti;">;His Medical Textbook");. I translated the entire book, which is also the first complete translation in my country, but I also used the title left by my predecessors when translating it: "His Internal Medicine".

;

;The Chinese translation of "His Internal Medicine" came out and received widespread attention. This is not because I really did anything great, but the characteristics of that era: reform and opening up, people's hearts are exciting, and a drama, A movie or a novel can often cause a sensation.

;

;;

;

;Invited to attend the launch ceremony of the 15th edition of the Chinese translation of "Historical" in Beijing. On the left is editor-in-chief Xu Cheng.

;

;When "His Internal Medicine" was first published in Beijing, it was not available for purchase in separate volumes ;(usually available);. Buyers are still coming in an endless stream. An old man rode a bicycle from the suburbs early to buy books. He is an engineer and there is no one in his family who is studying medicine. When I signed it for him, I reminded him that this was not a popular science book, but he still insisted on buying it. Later, when I was working on the supplementary translation of the 17th and 18th editions of "His", my leader actually decided that the translation manuscript would be serialized in a comprehensive medical journal first, and the translation would be published as soon as possible. GB2312, SimKai, STKaiti;">;(The length of the publication has been increased for this purpose);. It will be published in one year and then submitted to the publishing house for compilation and publication. After this decision was published in the newspaper, the magazine's mailing volume increased nearly three times that year! These are unimaginable and difficult to understand now.

;

;As a world famous medical book, "His Internal Medicine" has been translated into many languages, including Italian, Japanese, Spanish, and Portuguese. The book was translated by a team of hundreds of experts in various countries. There has never been a single People completed the translation of the entire book of "His". Ma Haider, a consultant to the Ministry of Health and a famous leprosy expert ; (Chinese-American); said that overseas media called Wang Xiancai a "CCP I was asked what I thought about the "unearthed relics" that emerged after the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee of the Communist Party of China. I said that they were right to see the decisive role of the Third Plenary Session of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and reform and opening up, but it was not that I was particularly capable. It was my situation and experience that determined that I could only fight alone.

;

;Postscript

;

;In the following years, I also translated:

;

;"Concise Histology of Internal Medicine" 2nd Edition;(1.41 million words;).

;

;The supplementary translation of the 17th and 18th editions of "His Internal Medicine" ; (1.5 million words) ;.

;

;The 21st edition of "Western Internal Medicine" ; (6 million words, due to cooperation with Xi'an World Book Publishing Company , they suggested changing "His" to "West");.

;

;The 22nd edition of "Western Internal Medicine" ; (8.15 million words) ;.

;

;;

;

;Different versions of "His Internal Medicine" have been translated one after another.

;

;Together with the first published 15th edition of "His", I have been exposed to 9 different editions, with a total of 21.06 million words translated and published. Of all the translations I have done so far, nearly half of them are in the "His" series; the relationship between them can be said to be profound.

;

;I retired in November 2003 at the age of 70. The 22nd edition of "Historical Masters" ; (8.15 million words); is a translation after retirement. Looking back on my life, I have published 15 major translations of 37 books with about 50 million words. China may be the country with the largest number of translated words in the world, because developed countries do not need a large number of scientific and technological translations.

;

;;

;

;Me and my main translations. The front and bottom is a young book "Instructions for Clinical Surgery" first published in 1957. It was an ugly duckling, insignificant, but it led to the subsequent translations and also started a long and bumpy road, so I always have more feelings for it.

; Sun, 03 Dec 2023 14:55:03 +0800 朱丹为闺蜜担保背负巨债：友谊塑料，情比金坚http://www.infzm.com/contents/261762

;

;Being let down, betrayed, and deceived by friends can have many endings - such as "stabbing in the back", such as when I Nearly 30 years ago, I lent a large sum of money to my best friend, but it was never repaid. This money was supposed to be used to prepare me for big things. But there are very few people who are as miserable as Zhu Dan and have no friends.

;

;Recently, Zhu Dan revealed when participating in a program that he was defrauded of all his savings by a friend many years ago. She was deceived by her friend into being a debt guarantor and wrote her name on a blank piece of paper. As a result, she was forced to use all her savings to pay off all her friend's debts. Even if he won the lawsuit, the matter would end in Zhu Dan's misfortune because his shameless friend declared "bankruptcy."

;

;How much this money is, many people are concerned about this issue.

;

;Because the parties did not disclose specific figures, it is impossible to confirm. But this is not important, because we only need to know that this amount of money is beyond the imagination of ordinary people. The important thing is that this incident happened while Zhu Dan and Yiwei Yiwei were in love, but Yiwei Yi chose to repay the debt with Zhu Dan. In the program, when Zhu Dan recounted this unbearable event in a calm tone with red eyes under the wind chimes, Yiwei Yiwei looked at her with a distressed and forgiving look, as if he were facing a child who had been wronged. This scene It’s very emotional.

;

;I believe that many people have met people who do things without thinking, otherwise there would be so many "easy to deceive people" in the world. How stupid is Zhu Dan's hasty behavior? As one netizen said, your behavior as a human being should not be too outrageous, and you must have a basic bottom line. Zhu Dan's best friend sent her a piece of white paper, and she dared to sign it. It was difficult for a middle school student to do this. Even the judge couldn't help "teaching" Zhu Dan that he was legally illiterate. As long as he signed on the white paper, It is equivalent to admitting everything on this piece of paper.

;

;This netizen said that he does not have such a wife, but he has such a mother. These words also touched the sensitive parts of many people's hearts. I have relatives and friends who are like this. They don't listen to anything they say, and they only wake up after being deceived. However, it doesn't take long for them to fall into new routines again. As the saying goes, "Dangdang is different", some people just can't get out of this tragic scam "reincarnation". What can you do? Anyway, I heard that in addition to some parents "paying the bill" for their deceived children, there are many examples of couples breaking up.

;

;So I very much agree with what this netizen said: Yiwei Yi helped her pay off the debt. This behavior cannot be described as high-spirited and upright.

;

;In other words, Yiwei Yi seems to be indifferent to Zhu Dan, which is one of the reasons why some "black fans" have been criticizing Yiwei. Not only do they feel that Yiwei is not good to Zhu Dan, but they also habitually show off in public places. The "poker-faced" Zhou Yiwei got a lot of insults on his head. There are even rumors that the two are getting married. But now, many netizens woke up from the misunderstanding and discovered that Yiwei Yiwei is so good - "I apologize for talking about Yiwei before. If he can avoid divorce after such a thing, I respect him as a real man." "We endure hardships and enjoy happiness together." "There are not many people who can repay debts together. And it's a man, even less." "I thought he was quite shrewd, and it seemed like he was in love. I thought this kind of thing could only be done by parents to their children." "Come out" "Yiwei Zhou is a relatively aloof but loyal type".

;

;You know, at that time Yiwei could have broken up with Zhu Dan without having to sacrifice himself. Even if the two are already married, Yiwei Yi has every reason to ignore the "bad debt". After all, even according to the marriage law, it is not his responsibility.

;

;Zhu Dan was tricked by his friends, which is a typical example of being defrauded. According to legal principles, whether you have an obligation to repay debts caused by being defrauded depends on whether the debts are used jointly by the husband and wife. Unless there is evidence to prove that the debt belongs to the couple's common living use, the other party has no obligation and responsibility to repay it. Obviously, the occurrence of Zhu Dan's debt had nothing to do with Zhou Wei, nor was it the result of a joint discussion between the two.

;

;What’s ridiculous is that one netizen even commented that Zhou Yiwei actually used this matter to manipulate Zhu Dan and gain a useful slave. This is illogical. What can you do if you have tens of millions in your hand? What can you buy and eat? Do you have to give up half your life savings to someone else? Those who say this, and those who believe this, can also pay 10 million or 20 million for someone to treat you as a "master" and see if you are willing?

;

;It is really sad to see people without knowing their surroundings. We should feel lucky to still have such a kind and loving man like Yiwei Yi in our field of vision.

;

;It is precisely because of the old saying that "husband and wife are originally birds of the same forest, and they fly separately when disaster strikes", acts of friendship are particularly noble. If a couple wants to maintain a long-term relationship, it is not enough to have an emotional foundation. In a difficult and changing world, if there is a lack of moral support and a little noble personality from both parties, it is not surprising that the couple breaks up halfway.

;

;In the recently launched animated series "PLUTO" by Netflix, the audience once again saw the familiar robot Astro Boy from their childhood. This animated work depicts the existential crisis of humans and robots after the Central Asian War. The information is dense, neat and compact, and its lightness is as impressive as its heaviness.

;

;Hideo Kojima, the game producer and a well-known science fiction fan and animation fan, said, "This work is completely different from robot animations and hero animations that can only fight. This is Japanese manga (;Comics;), this is animation."

;

;The birth of ChatGPT made mankind realize that it may be replaced in the new technological environment Species crisis, the Palestinian-Israeli conflict caused tragic casualties. In this reality, "PLUTO" appeared: the shadow of the post-war period shrouded the entire earth, and Persia, which had lost its country, created the giant robot Pluto and wanted to destroy him. Seven of the world's strongest robots, including Astro Boy. In the fictional story, "war robot crisis" replaces "nuclear crisis", and "robot sanctions" replace "nuclear sanctions" in international politics.

;

;In 1964, Japanese cartoonist Osamu Tezuka launched the special "Astro Boy" episode "The Strongest Robot on Earth". From the 1950s to the 1970s when Japanese comics were on the rise, most cartoonists of Tezuka’s generation took a left-leaning political stance because of their experience in World War II. They were anti-war, respectful of life, and advocating equality in their works.

;

;In 2003, with the permission of Osamu Tezuka's son, cartoonist Naoki Urasawa created "PLUTO" based on "The Strongest Robot on Earth". "PLUTO", born in 2023, is an animated series created by Netflix on this basis. From the anti-war thoughts in 1964, to the Iraq War in 2003, to the Palestinian-Israeli conflict in 2023, the three creations of "PLUTO" correspond to the war backgrounds of different eras.

;

;Japan has long allowed the world to accept the artistic language of comics. Tokiwa-so cartoonists headed by Osamu Tezuka have redefined the depth and breadth of comics. Their depiction and exploration of emotions have made their works Crossing the boundaries of the audience. Although "PLUTO" takes place in the context of a grand robot war, its setting is still classical: How can a robot become more like a human? On the one hand, humans are afraid of being replaced by machines; on the other hand, they are full of discrimination against androids - humans have emotions, and robots are just inferior species.

;

;Robot, are you really not sad? When robots cry, even they themselves are surprised. Who am I? Am I really grieving? Are these reactions emotions, or a set of codes?

;

;While watching this animation, I needed to press the pause button several times and stop for a while. Its perception and depiction of emotions are very innocent and beautiful, and sadness comes in an extremely light way. When Astro Boy is destroyed, will he be allowed to declare "death"? Or it can only be declared "damaged and scrapped". Naoki Urasawa continues Tetsuka's exploration of "the relationship between man and others", and still almost stubbornly depicts the possibility of "understanding" in a world full of fragmentation and disputes. For example, the robot North 2 went to the hometown of a stubborn artist to find the piano music in the artist's dream; the dinner between the robot Astro Boy and Dr. Pegasus; Ulan, who lost Astro Boy, could not face his own perception. The little robot keeps running around, trying to help sad humans.

;

;I haven’t seen such an animated work for a long time. The last time it gave me such an emotional experience was the animated film "Ghost in the Shell". Its English name is "Ghost in the Shell". Those whispers in the machine body may be just ghosts that are difficult to define, but it happened after all, didn't it?

;According to CCTV's "Today's Statement" report, Yang's mother is a single mother, and her original condom was located in Dongcheng District, Beijing. The only house I have is my only son, Xiao Yang. She got 3.7 million from selling her house and transferred it to her son. She used it to buy a larger house in Tongzhou District, which she lived in and used as a wedding house for her son. Only her son's name was written on the property ownership certificate.

;

;In June 2019, Xiao Yang got married, and Yang’s mother lived with Xiao Yang and his wife in the new house. Soon after the marriage, the daughter-in-law had conflicts with Yang's mother over daily trivial matters. The relationship between Xiao Yang, who firmly stands by his wife, and Yang's mother continues to deteriorate. After that, Xiao Yang and his wife moved out of their new house. Later, because his wife had another quarrel with Yang's mother, Xiao Yang became angry and blocked Yang's mother on WeChat.

;

;In 2022, in order to solve the problem of her daughter’s schooling, Xiao Yang sent a WeChat message to her grandmother: “Sell the house in Tongzhou and let my mother use the money from her original sale to buy another house, and I will save money. Buy a house." "If my mother can't agree, I will go to court to sue my mother in one month. If it really goes to court, there will be no turning back on our mother-son relationship."

;

;Known After what her son said, Yang's mother said she was "completely heartbroken" and said she would be "homeless" if Xiao Yang sued her for obstruction. So Yang's mother sued Xiao Yang to return the purchase price of 3.7 million yuan for future pension purposes, and received the support of the court. This decision is in accordance with common law, or good customs.

;

;This is a typical case of the conflict between the extended family orientation and the small family orientation. The current statutory legal framework talks about the individual standard and the small family standard: the division of property is based on the boundaries between individuals and small families, and small families implement the "community property system"; parents have raised their children to adulthood and have done their best to support them. Adult children have the obligation to support their parents.

;

;Children who are minors must rely on their parents’ care, care and protection. Parents have custody and control over their children. When children become adults, they separate from their parents and form a nuclear family. If they get married and buy a house on their own, and do not receive support from their parents, nor do they expect to receive large amounts of property or inheritance from their parents, then the parents have not interfered with their children. A legitimate reason and effective starting point in life, children are "independent" from the extended family and gain the "sovereignty" of the small family. This is a normal intergenerational power transfer in a family.

;

;However, if on the one hand, the children get a large amount of support from their parents when they get married and buy a house, but on the other hand, they want to have a soft life and refuse their parents' interference in their lives (whether it is "suggestions" or "pointing fingers") Well, it’s actually the same thing), which essentially refuses parents to fulfill their “investor rights/powers”.

;

;As far as this case is concerned, the quarrel between the daughter-in-law and Yang's mother over "daily trivial matters" may have started because the daughter-in-law couldn't stand her mother-in-law's lifestyle, or she couldn't accept her mother-in-law's interference in the couple's lifestyle. ;After that, it was originally a tough and feasible plan to "sell the house in Tongzhou and let my mother use the money from her original sale to buy another house while I save money to buy another house." ;

;The court ultimately determined that the money was a loan. But even if it is a gift, it is conditional and can be withdrawn. The house I bought will be written on your name." You can name it whatever you want." Instead, "Mom, I have given all my belongings to prepare a wedding room for you. I will live with you. ;The Xiao Yangs not only failed to manage intergenerational conflicts and despised the rights/rights of investors, but instead took the initiative to escalate conflicts and regarded their widowed mother as an enemy. ;

;It’s okay to adhere to individual orientation + small family orientation, and at the same time insist on living independently and rejecting large-amount funding from parents; if you accept large-amount funding from parents, you must respect the rights/powers of the investor, and even You must have the awareness to be a low-key child. ;

;Furthermore, this case is also a warning to parents. By raising the children to adulthood, the parents' duty has been completed and the legal responsibilities have been fulfilled. You cannot hand over your old capital to your children casually, and your main assets must be in your own hands. If a child needs a large amount of financial aid, it can be lent in a clear way, stipulating the principal, interest and repayment plan, or at least it should be clear that the parents have the right to claim it back.
